results.title: The Princess and the Frog
results.brief_description: A waitress, desperate to fulfill her dreams as a restaurant owner, is set on a journey to turn a frog prince back into a human being, but she has to face the same problem after she kisses him.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

results.title: The Princess and the cobbler
results.creator_credit: Richard Williams, Richard Sutton, Imogen Sutton and Allied Filmmakers
results.brief_description: Set in a faraway land of magnificent palaces and beautiful Princesses, a sly thief, a shy cobbler and some very ugly brigands, do battle with an evil sorcerer to save a kingdom and rescue a beautiful princess. Following the tradition of “Aladdin” and “Ali Baba”, this animation is exciting family entertainment, with a wonderful musical score featuring the voices of Bobbi Page and Steve Lively, from “Beauty and the beast” and Vincent Price as the evil Zig Zag.

results.title: The Princess's wedding day
results.brief_description: Highlights of the wedding day of HRH Princess Elizabeth and Philip Mountbatten. Shows the procession of Elizabeth and George VI to Westminster Abbey, the marriage ceremony, the Royal couple with the King, Queen and Queen Mother waving to cheering crowds from the balcony at Buckingham Palace. Narrated by Anna Neagle.

results.title: The Prince of tides
results.creator_credit: Barbra Streisand, Andrew S Karsch, Longfellow, Barwood Films and Columbia
results.brief_description: New York psychiatrist, Susan Lowenstein (Barbra Streisand) confronts her own private pain when she delves into Tom Wingo’s (Nick Nolte) memories of his family’s past. Together they search for the key that may save Tom’s twin sister who repeatedly attempts suicide. Nick Nolte gives the most heartfelt and powerful performance of his career as a man who, in order to mend his sister’s emotional wounds, must finally come to terms with his own. Based on the best-selling novel by Pat Conroy and nominated for seven Academy Awards, this film is a compelling exploration of love - between men and women, parents and children, and, ultimately, love of oneself.

results.title: The Prince of Egypt
results.creator_credit: Simon Wells, Steve Hickner, Brenda Chapman, Sandra Rabins, Penney Finkelman Cox and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: An animated musical film which tells the story of Moses, based on the book of Exodus in the Old Testament. Follows Moses from the moment his mother sends him out onto the River Nile in a basket of reeds, to his triumphant leading of his people out of slavery in Egypt. In “Prince of Egypt” Dreamworks Pictures attempts to make an animated film on the scale of an epic film. It combines the cute cornball of animated characters and musical numbers with lavish biblical backdrops, such as the magnificently realised parting of the red sea. The cast of voices includes a who’s who of Hollywood stars. (Awards: Winner of 1998 Academy Award for Best Original Song - “When You Believe”)

results.title: The Prince of Central Park
results.creator_credit: Harvey Hart and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: Central Park, New York, inhabited nightly by muggers, rapists and killers, becomes the unlikely venue for two recently orphaned children, Jay Jay and Laurie to find a home. They do however, with Jay Jay proclaiming himself ‘The Prince of Central Park’. Into their world enters a lonely widow (Ruth Gordon), who is eager to share their sense of family and belonging. Based on the novel by Evan Rhodes.

results.title: The Prince and the showgirl
results.creator_credit: Terence Rattigan, Laurence Olivier, L O P Ltd and Marilyn Monroe Productions
results.brief_description: A dazzling American showgirl, (Marilyn Monroe) catches the monacled eye of a debonair prince, (Laurence Olivier). Opposites attract as His Higness Grand Duke Charles succumbs to the unpolished but vivacious Milwaukee chorus girl Elsie Marina, abandoning his “stuffed shirt” posture for her more commonsense approach to life. While the Prince’s state is beset by political worries, he seeks escape in an affair of the heart. Elsie is also interested in affairs, but in the affairs of State. When she pits her “Yankee” ingenuity against the Balkan bigwigs who want to remove Charles, they are no match. Monroe radiates beauty and charm, while Olivier is the perfect counterpart as the straight-man in this romantic comedy.

results.title: The Prince and the pauper (1937)
results.creator_credit: William Keighley, Robert Lord and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Tudor London, Edward IV, Price of Wales, is only thirteen years old, yet he is heir to the throne. For amusement, he changes his clothes with Tom, a pauper, who bears an uncanny resemblance to him. Circumstances, however, conspire to turn their childish prank into a dangerous game. Stars Errol Flynn and Claude Rains. Based on the novel by Mark Twain.

results.title: The Prince and the pauper
results.creator_credit: Chris Cuddington, Walter J Hucker and A P I Television Productions
results.brief_description: Set in Tudor London, Edward IV, Price of Wales, is only thirteen years old, yet he is heir to the throne. Some rather unexpected events take place when, for amusement, he changes his clothes with Tom, a pauper, who bears an uncanny resemblance to him. Made for television this animated film is based on the story by American writer, Mark Twain.

results.title: The Prince
results.creator_credit: Bill Jersey and Barr Media Group
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Renaissance”.
Documents the lives and accomplishments of the “Princes” of the Renaissance. Discover the motivations and political solutions of leaders such as Cosimo di Medici, Prince Philip of Spain and Queen Elizabeth of England. Learn about Machiavelli, a maligned political theorist, but one of the most influential figures in the politics of his age. Furthermore, explore the Renaissance leaders legacy that continues to influence today’s statesmen.
